intro: Faucherea glutinosa, commonly known as sticky faucherea, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and small trees. The plant is characterized by its glossy, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. Its fruit is a capsule that contains numerous tiny seeds. Faucherea glutinosa is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and shrublands.
